descript.abstract: Various county departments, local municipal agencies, and other not-for-profit organizations have identified the need for a digital soil coverage data set for Tompkins County, NY. The Tompkins County ITS GIS Division initiated and developed a digital soil coverage from the official analog soil map series produced and published by the United States Geology Survey (USGS) and Cornell University Agricultural Experiment Station. The field survey has been conducted during the 60es.
descript.purpose: To provide a GIS countywide coverage that consists of polygons defining the soils boundaries and to add enough basic attributes to achieve a fundamental degree of categorization. Open, all-purpose data set.
descript.supplinf: The field survey took place during the 60es and it has been published in a book titled: Soil Survey, Tompkins County NY, in 1965. Please refer to this book for more information regarding soil science. Attribute information can be found in an attached Soilsdef.DBF and SOILSDEF.TXT filesPrevious versions of Tompkins County Soil Associations in CUGIR include: <http://cugir2.mannlib.cornell.edu/buckets/Display.jsp?id=1631>

idinfo.useconst: The following statement must be included with any products that use or are derived from this data set: Data contained in this product was originally produced by the Tompkins County ITS GIS Division and may not be reproduced or redistributed without the express written consent of the originator. The originator does not warrant the accuracy or completeness of the information portrayed by the data, as it is currently still in draft format.

cntorgp.cntper: Greg Potter, Svetla Borovska, Steve Horn

idinfo.native: PATH: /DATA/ARCINFO/COUNTY/NYSP/PHYSICAL/SOILSURVEY SOFTWARE: WindowsNT 4.0 x86, Arc/Info Single Precision Coverage LAYERS: Polygons

citeinfo.title: Soil Survey, Tompkins County, New York

pubinfo.publish: US Department of Agriculture, Soil Conservation Service

attracc.attraccr: Assessed using the scanned source maps as background images in order to review the polygons attribute SOILNAME against the soil maps symbols (see "Source" and "Status" fields under Attribute Information).

dataqual.logic: Be aware of the initial error introduced by the source materials (see "Source Information") the data source is from the 60es and changes may have occurred. The horizontal positional accuracy has been assessed against data sets derived from 1991 Tompkins County Planimetric Series (see "Horizontal Positional Accuracy"). Data were geo-referenced using ER Mapper image-processing software (method: polynomial rectification using ground control points).

horizpa.horizpar: AVERAGE offset in feet is 38.9 Using the National Standart for Spatial Data Accuracy, the data set tested 70 feet horizontal accuracy at 95% confidence level.

citeinfo.title: Soil Survey, Tompkins County, New York

pubinfo.publish: US Department of Agriculture, Soil Conservation Service

srcinfo.srccitea: The official analog map series published in the 'Soil Survey, Tompkins County, NY' book.
srcinfo.srccontr: Tompkins County GIS 2000-2001 United States Department Of Agriculture and Cornell University Agricultural Experiment Station Published in 1965, book title: Soil Survey Tompkins County NY.

procstep.procdesc: Three main phases 1. Data geo-referencing and data extraction using ER Mapper software. 2. Vectorization and polygon topology using ESRI software. 3. Using a control data set with known higher accuracy to assess the soil coverage positional accuracy. Control data set: Road Centerline Arc coverage from 1991 Tompkins County Digital Planimetric Series. Using the road intersections as control points. Measuring the X and Y values from both data sets (the tested data set and the control data set). Statistic calculations based on the Accuracy Statistic Worksheet provided in the National Standard for Spatial Data Accuracy handbook.

enttyp.enttypd: Polygons outlining the soils by type
enttyp.enttypds: SOIL SURVEY Tompkins Couty, New York

attr.attrdef: The first capital letter is the initial one of the soil name. A second capital letter, A, B, C, D, E or F, shows the slope. A fort letter, capital K in a symbol shows that the slope is complex. Some simbols without a slope letter are for nearly level soils or land types, but others are for soils or land types that have a considerable range in slope. A final number, 3, in the symbol shows that the soil is eroded. Attribute information can be found in an attached Soilsdef.DBF and SOILSDEF.TXT files
attr.attrdefs: SOIL SURVEY Tompkins County, New Youk

overview.eaover: The data set contains of soil boundary polygons with label points. Each polygon defines a soil type represented by a symbol assigned in SOILNAME field.
overview.eadetcit: SOILNAME symbol legend: The first capital letter is the initial one of the soil name. A second capital letter, A, B, C, D, E or F, shows the slope. A fort letter, capital K in a symbol shows that the slope is complex. Some symbols without a slope letter are for nearly level soils or land types, but others are for soils or land types that have a considerable range in slope. A final number, 3, in the symbol shows that the soil is eroded.

distinfo.distliab: Cornell University provides these geographic data "as is". Cornell University makes no guarantee or warranty concerning the accuracy of information contained in the geographic data. Cornell University further makes no warranty either expressed or implied, regarding the condition of the product or its fitness for any particular purpose. The burden for determining fitness for use lies entirely with the user. Although these files have been processed successfully on computers at Cornell University, no warranty is made by Cornell University regarding the use of these data on any other system, nor does the fact of distribution constitute or imply any such warranty.
